replies.body:
Hi there nomoreflame naja,

It's pretty clear you've put a lot of time and effort into this post, and that you care about Cass, and that's cool. That said, you don't seem to really call out specifically the kind of change you're looking for, though you do suggest a lot of very specific changes.

Please do correct me, but it looks like you're interested in (and feel free to add others if they exist):

* A reason to max Q over E on certain matchups
* A bit more emphasis on poisons

For  someone that's not a Cassiopeia expert (like myself), can you explain to me why those are important to you, and why those problems currently exist?

Thanks!

Edit: I don't have any immediate well thought out plans or solutions, but I'm going to think about whether there are some easy wins to be had to retain her old poison mage feel.

Not the OP, but...

My problem with Cass is the entire rework. Yes, I understand that change is occasionally necessary, and apparently Cass was too much like a lane bully with her old kit, but I feel that the rework didn't actually solve any of her problems, and added new ones. Remember, she got nerfed into trash-tier after her rework (which required about 5 buffs from her release rework state) because she was too much like a lane bully; considering the rework was aimed at avoiding that, it's clearly been a failure from that perspective. It's a failure from a theme perspective, too; all of her VOs, both pre-and-post rework, revolve around her being manipulative and poisonous. The rework based her entire kit around a non-poison ability that is direct and to the point. And in terms of uniqueness, we lost one of our few DoT mages for what is essentially an ADC with a worse autoattack. 

My current problems with Cass are:
A) E. It is basically her entire kit at this point. Q is to speed yourself up to keep in range and enable resets, W is to slow down the enemy to keep in range and enable resets, R is to do the same thing. This is annoying because it is by far the least interesting part of her kit. If I wanted to hit someone a lot with a targeted ability, I'd play an ADC!

B) The passive. This is mostly come from an amateur game design perspective, not a gameplay one, because it has no gameplay. It's an arbitrary gating; a way to let you 'unlock' and start being super mega badass without actually doing anything differently. At least Veigar and Nasus have to farm stacks; Cass just gets it by...poisoning her enemies. Which she was gonna do anyway. It doesn't help that, instead of having a singular, granular benefit, like Veig and Nasus, she instead gets breakpoints that add seemingly random stuff to her kit (free CDR! Lifesteal!) in addition to the bonus AP.

C) She has mana issues. Her only form of mana sustain is killing a minion with an E. If she is not fighting near minions, and if she cannot afford to use an E to kill a minion, she is going to run out of mana. Even when she was SUPER BROKEN OP enough to warrant dumpstering she ran out of mana whenever she tried to kill anything that didn't die in 3 or so Es.

D) I don't think Riot understands her theme. Like, I get I harped on his often enough, and he doesn't deserve all the hate he gets, but it's clear Stashu did not understand why some people liked Cass. I harp on him enough for the 'Brand is a DoT mage!' comment, so I won't say that again, but he got so wrapped up in his idealized hyperscaling ADC analogue that he forgot he was dealing with a champion that people like on live, not a completely new character.

E) She's still clunky. It's difficult to see poison indicators in a teamfight and there's still the delay on Q, meaning if you Q-E someone fast enough you won't get the reset (which means you lost.) The positioning requirement on her ult is still really stupid in a game where Annie/Sona exist, especially combined with her delay. And making mistakes punishes her far more than most other champions, given she has to land a skillshot to get any mobility at all.

I guess this post kinda got away from me, but Cass does that. If I had to summarize the changes I want to see...:
I want her to be a poison mage; deal damage primarily through DoTs and cripple her enemies as utility. I think she should remain less mobile.
I want that passive gone; her old passive was boring, but it would help with her mana issues and had SOME gameplay attached to it.
General clunkiness gone; her ult isn't strong enough for the unreliability it has.

Forgive me for the brief anecdote but I promise it has a point...

Way back when Stashu was discussing the rework with us, he said that it was not ridiculous for a champion to have an ability that isn't satisfying if not combo'd to justify the weakness of Noxious Blast and Miasma. He compared Cass to Anivia, because Anivia's E is pretty weak unless it's been enabled by her Q and R. However, what he failed to realise is that he got the comparison backwards. Anivia's E is comparable to Twin Fang, not Noxious Blast or Miasma. If you use Twin Fang on an enemy that isn't poisoned, just like if Anivia uses E on an enemy that isn't chilled, it's not satisfying.

The problem is that Cass's QWR are more appropriately compared to Anivia's QR. They're the setup abilities. And there's a huge difference between them in that Anivia uses her R not just to set up her E, but to spread some big AOE damage and crowd control around. Anivia uses her Q not just to set up for E, but to get clutch stuns and do powerful damage in its own right. Her Q and R are satisfying moves independently, and in using her combo. Cass is the opposite - none of her abilities feel powerful on their own, their use in enabling her Twin Fang takes up the vast majority of their power budget. Throwing out W for a slow is OK, but even someone standing in it for the full duration doesn't feel strong (I've heard stories of people standing in it spamming laugh at level 1). Using Q for poke is something you can do if you have the mana, but it's not worth it after a few levels because you need to max E and the AP ratio is gutted. R is nice if it saves your skin but there's on point throwing down any poison on the person you've stunned unless you're gonna bite them to death.

If you were to rework Anivia today and absolutely slash the damage on all of her abilities, then give her E ridiculous stuff like spell vamp, mana sustain and much higher damage, you would have a champion that was roughly equivalent to the Cassiopeia of today. *That's the problem.*

tl;dr Cass needs to be more like Anivia. Anivia has 4 abilities that feel powerful, but her combo move needs to be enabled to be satisfying. That's great design and a balanced kit. Cass has 1 ability that feels powerful (E) and there isn't a single ability in her kit that feels satisfying if it's not combo'd, because the combo move (Twin Fang) is obviously worthless without being setup, but the enablers are worthless unless they're used for setup. No champion should feel like they have 3 abilities (really, 4 if you count the passive) that function only to serve one insanely overloaded ability.

p.s. it doesn't help that Cass's only good ability is one that doesn't have anything to do with poison - people who wanted to play a poison mage are genuinely better off playing Singed right now, what does that tell you?
